lines.text:
[Mable thinks she's talking to Pop and turns to a young lady sitting at one of the tables]
Oh, listen girlie! Don't worry about me. I always talk to myself... you see, I'm my own grandmother and I have to keep the old girl interested!
I used to go there in the summer as a kid. You know, before the war.
Lucky, please don't feel bad. You still got me. Course I ain't a young and pretty girl. I ain't even a girl, but I'll stick. I'll never leave you.

[after having just been hit in the face with a snowball]
You know, snow tastes just as bad as water.
What made you think of it?

[said sarcastically]
Oh, I don't know; my mind was wandering, I guess.
Listen. No one could teach you to dance in a million years. Take my advice and save your money!
Now, eh... how did you say that last step went? Eh... oh, yes!
